text.div:
Withhold Authorization for Treatment rule for Emegency Treatment

Patient "P. van de Heuvel" wishes to have no data at the Good Health Psychiatric Hospital available rule for Emergency treatment use. An overall Deny consent Directive, with an exception "Permit" of purposeOfUse "ETREAT" at "Good Health" hospital, and exception "Deny" all other purposeOfUse from good health hospital.

sourceAttachment.title: The terms of the consent in lawyer speak.

text.div:
The following scenario is based on a question asked on John Moehrke's blog in the Consent given to authorized representative

This is a case where a Patient is giving a limited (read-only) access to an individual.

Patient "P. van de Heuvel" wishes to provide XXX with read-only access to the data at Good Health Psychiatric Hospital available for patient requested access use.

sourceAttachment.title: The terms of the consent in lawyer speak.

text.div:
The following scenario is based on existing jurisdictional policy and are realized in existing systems in Canada. The default policy is one of implied consent for the provision of care, so these scenarios all deal with withdrawal or withholding consent for that purpose. In other jurisdictions, where an express consent model is used (Opt-In), these would examples would contain the phrase "consent to" rather than "withhold" or "withdraw" consent for.

specific to use-case 5) Withhold or withdraw consent for disclosure of records that were authored by a specific organization (or service delivery location).

Patient "P. van de Heuvel" wishes to have all of the PHI collected at the Good Health Psychiatric Hospital restricted from disclosure to every provider.

sourceAttachment.title: The terms of the consent in lawyer speak.

text.div:
The following scenario is based on existing jurisdictional policy and are realized in existing systems in Canada. The default policy is one of implied consent for the provision of care, so these scenarios all deal with withdrawal or withholding consent for that purpose. In other jurisdictions, where an express consent model is used (Opt-In), these would examples would contain the phrase "consent to" rather than "withhold" or "withdraw" consent for.

specific to use-case 3) Withhold or withdraw consent for disclosure to a specific provider organization

Patient "P. van de Heuvel" ex-spouse is a Physician that is employed by Good Health Clinic. P. decides that he would like to withdraw/withhold consent to disclose any instance of his health information to Good Health Clinic.

sourceAttachment.title: The terms of the consent in lawyer speak.

text.div:
The following scenario is based on existing jurisdictional policy and are realized in existing systems in Canada. The default policy is one of implied consent for the provision of care, so these scenarios all deal with withdrawal or withholding consent for that purpose. In other jurisdictions, where an express consent model is used (Opt-In), these would examples would contain the phrase "consent to" rather than "withhold" or "withdraw" consent for.

specific to use-case 4) Withhold or withdraw consent for disclosure to a specific provider agent (an individual within an organization)

Patient "P. van de Heuvel" ex-spouse, Bill T Lookafter is a Nurse that is employed by Good Health Hospital. P. realizes that she may receive treatment at GHH, however she does not want her ex-spouse to have any access to her IIHI. She indicates that she would like to withdraw/withhold consent to disclose any instance of her health information to her ex-spouse as a result of his employment at Good Health Clinic.

sourceAttachment.title: The terms of the consent in lawyer speak.

text.div:
The following scenario is based on existing jurisdictional policy and are realized in existing systems in Canada. The default policy is one of implied consent for the provision of care, so these scenarios all deal with withdrawal or withholding consent for that purpose. In other jurisdictions, where an express consent model is used (Opt-In), these would examples would contain the phrase "consent to" rather than "withhold" or "withdraw" consent for.

specific to use-case 2. Withhold or withdraw consent for disclosure of a specific record (e.g. Lab Order/Result)

Patient "P. van de Heuvel" Primary Care Provider, Dr. Philip Primary, has ordered a set of lab test which Adam wishes to keep as private as possible. At the sample collection facility, he indicates that he would like withhold consent to disclose the order and all results associated with that specific order from all other providers

sourceAttachment.title: The terms of the consent in lawyer speak.

text.div:
The following scenario is based on existing jurisdictional policy and are realized in existing systems in Canada. The default policy is one of implied consent for the provision of care, so these scenarios all deal with withdrawal or withholding consent for that purpose. In other jurisdictions, where an express consent model is used (Opt-In), these would examples would contain the phrase "consent to" rather than "withhold" or "withdraw" consent for.

specific to use-case 6. Withhold or withdraw consent for disclosure of records related published during a timeframe

Patient "P. van de Heuvel" wishes to withhold disclosure of all data from a timeframe to any provider.

The following scenario is based on existing jurisdictional policy and are realized in existing systems in Canada. The default policy is one of implied consent for the provision of care, so these scenarios all deal with withdrawal or withholding consent for that purpose. In other jurisdictions, where an express consent model is used (Opt-In), these would examples would contain the phrase "consent to" rather than "withhold" or "withdraw" consent for.

Specific to use-case 0) Withhold Authorization of sharing data for Treatment

Patient "P. van de Heuvel" wishes to have no data at the Good Health Psychiatric Hospital available for normal treatment use.

parameters.name: actor
parameters.description: Resource for the actor (or group, by role)

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Classification of the consent statement - for indexing/retrieval

parameters.name: consentor
parameters.description: Who is agreeing to the policy and rules

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: When this Consent was created or indexed

parameters.name: purpose
parameters.description: Context of activities covered by this rule

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Which of the four areas this resource covers (extensible)

parameters.name: security-label
parameters.description: Security Labels that define affected resources

parameters.name: source-reference
parameters.description: Search by reference to a Consent, DocumentReference, Contract  or QuestionnaireResponse

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: draft | proposed | active | rejected | inactive | entered-in-error

info.description: A healthcare consumer's  choices to permit or deny recipients or roles to perform actions for specific purposes and periods of time
info.title: FHIR R4 Consent Resource

Consent.description: A healthcare consumer's  choices to permit or deny recipients or roles to perform actions for specific purposes and periods of time

category.description: Classification of the consent statement - for indexing/retrieval

dateTime.description: When this  Consent was issued / created / indexed.

identifier.description: Unique identifier for this copy of the Consent Statement.

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

organization.description: The organization that manages the consent, and the framework within which it is executed.

patient.description: The patient/healthcare consumer to whom this consent applies.

performer.description: Who is agreeing to the policy and rules

policyRule.description: A reference to the specific base computable regulation or policy.

scope.description: Which of the four areas this resource covers (extensible)

source[x].description: Source from which this consent is taken

status.description: Indicates the current state of this consent.

text.description: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

uri.description: Specific policy covered by this consent

actor.description: Who|what controlled by this rule (or group, by role)

class.description: e.g. Resource Type, Profile, CDA, etc.

code.description: e.g. LOINC or SNOMED CT code, etc. in the content

dataPeriod.description: Timeframe for data controlled by this rule

purpose.description: Context of activities covered by this rule

securityLabel.description: Security Labels that define affected resources

reference.description: Resource for the actor (or group, by role)

coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

text.description: Plain text representation of the concept

implicitRules.description: A set of rules under which this content was created

language.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

url.description: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

period.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

system.description: The namespace for the identifier value

lastUpdated.description: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.

profile.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to

security.description: Security Labels applied to this resource

source.description: Identifies where the resource comes from

display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

identifier.description: Logical reference, when literal reference is not known

reference.description: Literal reference, Relative, internal or absolute URL

contentType.description: Mime type of the content, with charset etc.

creation.description: The date that the attachment was first created.

data.description: The actual data of the attachment - a sequence of bytes, base64 encoded.

hash.description: The calculated hash of the data using SHA-1. Represented using base64.

language.description: The human language of the content. The value can be any valid value according to BCP 47.

size.description: The number of bytes of data that make up this attachment (before base64 encoding, if that is done).

title.description: A label or set of text to display in place of the data.

url.description: A location where the data can be accessed.

div.description: The actual narrative content, a stripped down version of XHTML.

code.description: Symbol in syntax defined by the system

display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

system.description: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

userSelected.description: If this coding was chosen directly by the user

version.description: Version of the system - if relevant

end.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing

start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.
